p: The review covers also the major compounds isolated from some of these essential oils. The most of those compounds belong to terpene class; among these active constituents: Cineol, Carvacrol and thymol. Thus, the different essential oils that have been cited in this review were shown that have an antioxidant activity which play a key role in the reducing of the oxidative stress induced by the hepatotoxines. However, several efforts must be made to value these essential oils and identify the active constituents responsible for the hepatoprotective activity.
